Mesec: Ugotavljamo, da je vlada dokončno odstopila od dogovora, sporazum ne velja več
06 Nov 2019, 16:18 by STA

Koordinator Levice Luka Mesec je opozoril, da bi koalicija s sprejemom dopolnil povozila predlog Levice za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja. “Padla je še zadnja domina, ugotavljamo, da je vlada dokončno prekinila sodelovanje in odstopila od dogovora z nami,” je dejal Mesec in dodal, da za Levico odslej sporazum ni več obvezujoč.



Luka Mesec Foto: STA

LJUBLJANA > Odbor DZ za zdravstvo je bil danes po napovedi koalicije, da bo vložila dopolnila k predlogu zakona Levice, prekinjen. V Levici so ugotovili, da dopolnila ne ukinjajo dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja, ampak “ga le zavijajo v nov celofan, koalicija si z njim umiva roke”, je na novinarski konferenci dejal Luka Mesec.
Namen ukinitve tega zavarovanja je namreč po njegovih besedah solidarnostno plačevanje prispevka, kar je treba urediti s prenosom dopolnilnega zavarovanja v obvezno. To predlog Levice ureja, “koalicija pa bi s svojimi dopolnili predlog povozila in ohranila enak prispevek za vse ne glede na dohodek”. V Levici tako ugotavljajo, da je koalicija pokazala svoje nestrinjanje s predlogom Levice, za katerega pa so po mnenju Mesca imeli več kot dovolj časa za usklajevanje.
“Več kot dva meseca so imeli na voljo, da bi se z nami uskladili, a so danes neusklajeno, ob začetku obravnave predloga na odboru za zdravstvo s polurno prekinitvijo prinesli dopolnila, o katerih smo prvič slišali. Tudi po ugotovitvah zakonodajno-pravne službe spreminjajo zakon do te mere, da gre dejansko za drug zakon,” je opozoril Mesec.
Po njegovih besedah je tako danes padla še zadnja domina in je vlada dokončno prekinila sodelovanje z Levico. Poleg tega je izpostavil še spremembe dohodninske lestvice, ukinitev dodatka za delovno aktivnost ter po njihovem mnenju nesocialni ter nerazvojni proračun. Na te projekte so bili vezani pogoji organov stranke za nadaljnje sodelovanje z vlado, a jih koalicija ni izpolnila.
Sporazum, ki so ga sklenili z vlado, tako po besedah Mesca za Levico ni več zavezujoč in so odslej v polni opoziciji. Mesec je ob tem zatrdil, da s tem ne rušijo vlade Marjana Šarca, s katero so spomladi sklenili sporazum o sodelovanju za letos. “Mi le ugotavljamo, da je vlada odstopila od dogovora, ki ga je sklenila z Levico, kar na vseh naštetih primerih drži,” je poudaril.
Dodal je, da bi si želeli sodelovanja z vlado, a je “problem, da nas je vlada že nekaj mesecev ignorirala”. Spomnil je na njihov semafor sprejemanja ukrepov in usodo predlogov ter dejal, da so slednji popolnoma razvodeneli ali pa jih je vlada povozila.
Na vprašanje, ali je glede na njihov nov opozicijski status v kratkem pričakovati vložitev kakšne interpelacije, Mesec ni odgovoril konkretno. O tem, kako bodo ravnali v prihodnje, bodo po njegovih navedbah komunicirali v prihodnjih dneh.

Month: We find that the government has definitively withdrawn the agreement, the agreement is no longer valid
06 Nov 2019, 15:18 by STA

Levica Coordinator Luka Mesec warned that by adopting the Coalition, the Coalition would overrule Levica's proposal to terminate supplementary health insurance. "The last domino has fallen, and we note that the government has finally ceased cooperation and withdrew from the agreement with us," Moon said, adding that the agreement was no longer binding on Levica.



Luka Moon Photo: STA

LJUBLJANA> The parliamentary health committee was suspended today following a coalition's announcement that it would file amendments to the Levice bill. Levica noted that the supplements do not abolish supplementary health insurance, but "just wrap it in new cellophane, the coalition is washing its hands with it," Luka Mesec said at a news conference.
The purpose of the cancellation of this insurance is, according to him, solidarity payment of the contribution, which should be regulated by transferring the supplementary insurance to the compulsory one. The proposal is governed by the Left, and "the Coalition would supplement the proposal by retaining it and retain the same contribution for all regardless of income." The Left is thus noted that the coalition has shown its disagreement with the Left's proposal, for which, according to Moon, they have more than enough time to coordinate.
“For more than two months, they had the opportunity to bring us in line with, but uncoordinated today, bringing the amendments we first heard about at the Health Committee with a half-hour break. Even according to the findings of the legislative and legal services, they are changing the law to such an extent that it is, in fact, another law, ”Moon noted.
According to him, the last dominoes have fallen today and the government has finally suspended cooperation with the Left. He also highlighted changes in the income tax scale, the abolition of the employment allowance and, in their opinion, the social and underdeveloped budget. These projects were tied to the conditions of party bodies for further cooperation with the government, but were not met by the coalition.
According to the Moon, the agreement they have made with the government is no longer binding and are now in full opposition. He also said that they were not destroying the government of Marjan Sarac, which signed a cooperation agreement this spring. "We only find that the government has withdrawn from the agreement it has made with the Left, which is true in all the above cases," he stressed.
He added that they would like to cooperate with the government, but "the problem is that the government has been ignoring us for months". He recalled their traffic light and the fate of the proposals, saying that the two were either completely diluted or overruled by the government.
Asked if, given their new opposition status, any interpellation could be expected shortly, Moon did not give a concrete answer. According to him, they will communicate in the future in the coming days.
